title: Add Gold Water Tracker page with embedded Quench Joy Flow site

requirements.text: Create a new frontend page titled "Gold Water Tracker" that embeds the full site https://quench-joy-flow.lovable.app/ in an iframe, with responsive sizing that works on mobile and desktop.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to the new page shows an iframe rendering https://quench-joy-flow.lovable.app/ (full site, not a partial section).
The embedded site is usable on common viewport sizes (mobile and desktop) without horizontal overflow in the parent app.
The iframe includes an accessible title and does not break the surrounding app layout (header/footer remain visible).

requirements.text: Add a new route for the "Gold Water Tracker" page at a stable path (e.g., "/gold-water-tracker") in the TanStack Router configuration so it can be navigated to directly by URL.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the route path directly loads the Gold Water Tracker page via the existing router (no blank screen / no 404).
The new route is lazy-loaded consistently with other non-landing pages.

requirements.text: Expose navigation to the new "Gold Water Tracker" page from the app navigation (desktop header nav and mobile menu) using English user-facing text.
acceptanceCriteria: Desktop navigation includes a link labeled "Gold Water Tracker" that navigates to the new route.
Mobile navigation includes a link labeled "Gold Water Tracker" that navigates to the new route and closes the mobile sheet.
All user-facing labels added for this feature are in English.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only Shadcn components).
Do not modify immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., Internet Identity hooks and main.tsx).
No backend changes are required for this embed; implement as a frontend-only feature.
nonGoals: Recreating the water tracker natively in React (must embed the existing site).
Adding authentication, data syncing, or persistence for the embedded tracker.
Changing or fixing the external site https://quench-joy-flow.lovable.app/ itself.
